definition: to push back (progress, the times etc)
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage

sentences.english: Keeping the cuticles pushed back will also help keep nails healthy.
sentences.chinese: 保持角質層推後也將有助於保持健康的指甲。

sentences.english: If your period is more than one week late, take a pregnancy test.
sentences.chinese: 如果月經已經推後超過一週，需要進行早孕檢測。

sentences.english: How many home repairs have you been putting off?
sentences.chinese: 家裏有多少需要修理的地方被你推後？

sentences.english: Ministers are using delaying tactics to postpone the report yet again.
sentences.chinese: 部長們再次使用拖延戰術來推後報告的時間。

sentences.english: Too much of the boost to demand is backloaded to 2010 and beyond.
sentences.chinese: 太多急需的提振措施被推後到2010年甚至更遠。

definition: lit. to rush at thin air/fig. to miss one's aim/to have nothing to show for one's troubles
to hold a (business) meeting/to start negotiations
to act with urgency/to buy time
Dacun township in Changhua county 彰化縣|彰化县[Zhang1 hua4 xian4], Taiwan
to relax with one's eyes closed
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
it's the most capable people who do the most work (idiom) (intended as consolation for the overworked, or flattery when making a request etc)
